Container.Name: Zipline
Container.Overview:
A file upload server (ShareX/Flameshot) that is easy to use, packed with features, and easy to setup! This Unraid configuration is setup and ready to deploy and use instantly, the only configuration necessary is providing your PostgreSQL database credentials!
**An external PostgreSQL database is required!**
Once the container has started you can visit Zipline's webUI (default port 8092), the default login credentials are: **Username:** `administrator` **Password:** `password`
For advanced configuration, expand the settings when creating the container. Additionally, see a full list of available environment variables in the documentation: (https://zipline.diced.sh/docs/config)

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: The port to serve the Zipline frontend WebUI.

Config.Name: Storage (Uploads)
Config.Description: The directory to store all user uploads.

Config.Name: Storage (Public)
Config.Description: The directory to store publicly shared assets.

Config.Name: Secret Key
Config.Description: The secret key used to sign sensitive data, enter a random string here (up to 32 characters).

Config.Name: PostgreSQL Connection String
Config.Description: The PostgreSQL connection string for the Postgres database to use.

Config.Name: Enable Invites
Config.Description: Disable or enable invites. If disabled, users will not be able to invite other users to Zipline.

Config.Name: Enable User Registration
Config.Description: Disable or enable user registration. If disabled, users will not be able to register themselves.

Config.Name: Website Title
Config.Description: The title of the website. This will change anything that says

Config.Name: User Upload Limit
Config.Description: The amount of bytes that can be uploaded by a user. For more info on what values are accepted, see Zipline documentation.

Config.Name: Admin File Upload Limit
Config.Description: The amount of bytes that can be uploaded by an admin. For more info on what values are accepted, see Zipline documentation.

Config.Name: Show Version in Sidebar
Config.Description: Whether or not to show the Zipline version in the sidebar. A red badge will appear if there is a new version available showing that you are on an outdated version.

Config.Name: Share User Statistics
Config.Description: Due to privacy concerns when running Zipline with many users, you may want to hide the number of files a user has uploaded from the statistics page so that other users do not see emails or usernames.

Config.Name: Disable Media Preview
Config.Description: For those who want to save data, or just don't want to have image previews on the dashboard, you can disable them here. Defaults to being enabled.

Config.Name: Use HTTPS (SSL)
Config.Description: Whether or not to return HTTPS in upload URLs. This may be useful when using cloudflare's SSL and not your own.

Config.Name: Statistic Refresh Interval
Config.Description: The number of seconds to wait until refreshing statistics of Zipline. This is used to reduce load times when viewing statistics on the dashboard.

Config.Name: Invite Clear Interval
Config.Description: The number of seconds to wait until clearing expired or used invites from the database. This is used as invites that are expired are not automatically removed from the database.

Config.Name: Thumbnail Generation Interval
Config.Description: The number of seconds to wait until generating thumbnails for videos, that don't have thumbnails already associated with them.

Config.Name: Enable TOTP
Config.Description: Whether or not TOTP is enabled. If set to false, TOTP will not be available.

Config.Name: TOTP Issuer Name
Config.Description: The custom issuer for the TOTP QR code. This is the name of the service that will be displayed on the TOTP app.

Config.Name: File Route
Config.Description: The route to serve files on.

Config.Name: URL Shortener Route
Config.Description: The route to serve shortened urls on.

Config.Name: URL Shortener Length
Config.Description: The length of a random alphanumeric string to use as the short URL.

Config.Name: Enable Exiftool Metadata
Config.Description: Whether or not Exiftool metadata is enabled. If set to false, Exiftool metadata will not be available. If enabled, you can view metadata for each file by clicking on the image and clicking the

Config.Name: Remove EXIF GPS Data
Config.Description: Whether or not to remove GPS data from Exiftool metadata. If set to true, GPS data will be removed from Exiftool metadata. If set to false, GPS data will be kept in Exiftool metadata. This option works regardless of EXIF_ENABLED.

Config.Name: User Rate Limit (Seconds)
Config.Description: The amount of seconds a user has to wait before upload another image.

Config.Name: Admin Rate Limit (Seconds)
Config.Description: The amount of seconds a admin has to wait before upload another image.
